question.text: You are on a motorway in an Active Traffic Management (ATM) area. A mandatory speed limit is displayed above the hard shoulder. What does this mean?

explanation.text: A mandatory speed limit sign above the hard shoulder shows that it can be used as a running lane between junctions. You must stay within the speed limit. Look out for vehicles that may have broken down and could be blocking the hard shoulder.

answer.text: You should not travel in this lane
The hard shoulder can be used as a running lane
You can park on the hard shoulder if you feel tired
You can pull up in this lane to answer a mobile phone
